Detailed Description

The CameraListener class specifies the methods used to notify the status of the camera during the camera operation events.

The following example demonstrates how to use the CameraListener.

 // MyCameraListener

 class MyCameraListener : CameraListener {
 public:
     MyCameraListener();
     virtual ~MyCameraListener();
     void onAutoFocus(bool success, Camera* camera);
 };


 // MyCameraListener

 void MyCameraListener::onAutoFocus(bool success,
                 Camera* camera) {

 }


 MyPage::onInit(Persistence* const savedInstanceState){
     // new a instance
     Camera *mpCamera = Camera->open();

     // new a listener
     MyCameraListener *mpl = new MyCameraListener();

     // call the callback function
     mpCamera->onAutoFocus(true,mpCamera);

     // ...

 }
See also:
Camera

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum gaia::media::CameraListener::CameraError

CAMERA_ERROR_UNKNOWN - Unspecified camera error.

CAMERA_ERROR_SERVER_DIED - Media server died. In this case, the application must release the Camera object and instantiate a new one.

See also:
CameraListener.onError
Enumerator:
CAMERA_ERROR_UNKNOWN 
CAMERA_ERROR_RELEASED 

Camera was released because another client has connected to the camera.

The original client should call Camera::disconnect immediately after getting this notification. Otherwise, the camera will be released by camera service in a short time. The client should not call any method (except disconnect and sending CAMERA_CMD_PING) after getting this.

CAMERA_ERROR_SERVER_DIED

gaia::media::CameraListener::DISALLOW_COPY_AND_ASSIGN ( CameraListener  ) [private]
virtual void gaia::media::CameraListener::onAutoFocus ( bool  success,
const Camera &  camera 
) [pure virtual]

Called when the camera auto focus completes.

If the camera does not support auto-focus and autoFocus is called, onAutoFocus will be called immediately with a fake value of success set to true.

The auto-focus routine does not lock auto-exposure and auto-white balance after it completes.

Parameters:
successtrue if focus was successful, false if otherwise
camerathe Camera service object
See also:
CameraParameters::setAutoExposureLock(bool)
CameraParameters::setAutoWhiteBalanceLock(bool)

virtual void gaia::media::CameraListener::onPreviewFrame ( const base::ByteArray &  data,
const Camera &  camera 
) [pure virtual]

Called as preview frames are displayed.

This callback is invoked on the event thread Camera#open(int) was called from.

Parameters:
datathe contents of the preview frame in the format defined by ImageFormat, which can be queried with CameraParameters#getPreviewFormat(). If CameraParameters#setPreviewFormat(int) is never called, the default will be the YCbCr_420_SP (NV21) format.
camerathe Camera service object.
virtual void gaia::media::CameraListener::onShutter ( ) [pure virtual]

Called as near as possible to the moment when a photo is captured from the sensor.

This is a good opportunity to play a shutter sound or give other feedback of camera operation. This may be some time after the photo was triggered, but some time before the actual data is available.

virtual void gaia::media::CameraListener::onZoomChange ( int32_t  zoomValue,
bool  stopped,
const Camera &  camera 
) [pure virtual]

Called when the zoom value has changed during a smooth zoom.

Parameters:
zoomValuethe current zoom value. In smooth zoom mode, camera calls this for every new zoom value.
stoppedwhether smooth zoom is stopped. If the value is true, this is the last zoom update for the application.
camerathe Camera service object
